definition: to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to throw/to cast/left-slanting downward brush stroke (calligraphy)

sentences.english: He smirked and pushed the microscope to me.
sentences.chinese: 他撇嘴壞笑，把顯微鏡推給我。

sentences.english: He curled his lips in disdain.
Mrs. Otter, who did not like Clutton, pursed her lips.
sentences.chinese: 奧特爾太太撇了撇嘴，她不喜歡克拉頓。

sentences.english: The blue jade put on the sweat bead of putting on the forehead, Pie Pie mouth way.
sentences.chinese: 藍玉抹了抹額頭的汗珠，撇了撇嘴道。

sentences.english: "Feed, you why Pie mouth?"He challenges to me.
sentences.chinese: “喂，你爲什麼撇嘴？”他向我挑釁。

sentences.english: He gave his familiar, twisted grin .
sentences.chinese: 他露出了熟悉的撇嘴露齒的笑容。

sentences.english: She quirked her mouth at me.
The rain was lower, color of romance.
sentences.chinese: 窗外的雨撇了撇嘴，彩色的浪漫。

sentences.english: He shot Harry a nasty grin through the gap in his mother's arms.
sentences.chinese: 他躲在母親臂彎裏不懷好意地朝哈利撇嘴一笑。

sentences.english: Not just when she opens her mouth, if she ever does. Speaking of…
sentences.chinese: 還不單單只是她撇嘴的表情咧。

definition: to throw/to cast/left-slanting downward brush stroke (calligraphy)
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to cast sidelong glances at sb
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
